t: To the chief Musician upon Shoshannim, for the sons of Korah, Maschil, A Song of loves.
My*p heart is inditing a good matter: I speak of the things which I have made touching the king: my tongue is the pen of a ready writer.
Thou*p art fairer than the children of men: grace is poured into thy lips: therefore God hath blessed thee for ever.
Gird*p thy sword upon thy thigh, O most mighty, with thy glory and thy majesty.
And*p in thy majesty ride prosperously because of truth and meekness and righteousness; and thy right hand shall teach thee terrible things.
Thine*p arrows are sharp in the heart of the king's enemies; whereby the people fall under thee.
Thy*p throne, O God, is for ever and ever: the sceptre of thy kingdom is a right sceptre.
Thou*p lovest righteousness, and hatest wickedness: therefore God, thy God, hath anointed thee with the oil of gladness above thy fellows.
All*p thy garments smell of myrrh, and aloes, and cassia, out of the ivory palaces, whereby they have made thee glad.
Kings'*p daughters were among thy honourable women: upon thy right hand did stand the queen in gold of Ophir.
Hearken,*p O daughter, and consider, and incline thine ear; forget also thine own people, and thy father's house;
So*p shall the king greatly desire thy beauty: for he is thy Lord; and worship thou him.
And*p the daughter of Tyre shall be there with a gift; even the rich among the people shall entreat thy favour.
The*p king's daughter is all glorious within: her clothing is of wrought gold.
She*p shall be brought unto the king in raiment of needlework: the virgins her companions that follow her shall be brought unto thee.
With*p gladness and rejoicing shall they be brought: they shall enter into the king's palace.
Instead*p of thy fathers shall be thy children, whom thou mayest make princes in all the earth.
I*p will make thy name to be remembered in all generations: therefore shall the people praise thee for ever and ever.
